New Records: Morocco won 6-0 against Congo in World Cup qualifying match, a significant victory in their bid to qualify for the 2026 edition
Key Match Events: Morocco scored 6 goals, with Ounahi (8'), Riad (16'), El Kaabi (20', 39', 53'), Rahimi (62') scoring for Morocco, while Makouta (12'), Andzouana (15'), Tsouka (29'), Jeordon Otanga Mvouo (83') scored for Congo
Pre-Game Insights: Congo were due to play Niger in a neutral stadium in Kinshasa, but the match was cancelled due to a late request from Congo to move the game to Brazzaville, which Niger refused
Morocco have an abundance of quality that will be too much for Congo to handle
Post-Match Reflections: Congo go into Tuesday's clash without a point in Group E and are winless in their last four games across all competitions
Morocco currently sit top of Group E with six points from two games, three clear of the next three teams behind them
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was moved from Kinshasa to Morocco's Grand Stadium of Agadir due to FIFA's non-approval of the original venue
Congo have a poor record against Morocco, having never won in three meetings, losing twice and drawing once
